description:
Looks like the following functions in  sqlalchemy/api.py need to have "session=None"  added as an argument to make them consistent with the db/api.py  (Otherwise they fail with too many arguments being passed) 

task_log_get()
task_log_get_all()
task_log_begin_task()
task_log_end_task()

Also task_log_get() and task_log_get_all() need to pass context to _task_log_get_query()
title: Missing Session argument to task_get_log and friends in sqlalchemy/api.py

comments.content:
Looks like the following functions in  sqlalchemy/api.py need to have "session=None"  added as an argument to make them consistent with the db/api.py  (Otherwise they fail with too many arguments being passed) 

task_log_get()
task_log_get_all()
task_log_begin_task()
task_log_end_task()

Also task_log_get() and task_log_get_all() need to pass context to _task_log_get_query()
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-day

comments.content: Session arguments are being removed from public methods as explained in https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-session-cleanup.  So this bug report could go the other way stating that db/api.py is passing session when it shouldn't be, but I'm not seeing that in the current code so it may have been addressed already.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski
